intro: Premna lamii, commonly known as the small-leaved morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a climbing shrub that produces small, trumpet-shaped flowers in shades of pink to purple. The plant has heart-shaped leaves with a smooth texture and is often found in moist, shaded environments. It belongs to the family Verbenaceae and is characterized by its rapid growth and ornamental value. Premna lamii is also used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
